subclassFeature.name: Great Assassin
entries: You focus your training on the grim art of death. Those who adhere to this archetype are diverseâ€”hired killers, spies, bounty hunters, and even specially anointed priests trained to exterminate the enemies of their deity. Stealth, poison, and disguise help you eliminate your foes with deadly efficiency.
Your archetype grants you features at 3rd level and then again at 9th, 13th, and 17th level.

subclassFeature.name: Assassinate
entries: You have mastered the arts of delivering death to your victims. Once per turn, you can give yourself advantage on a weapon attack; if the attack hits, it is considered a critical hit. You can use this ability a number of times equal to your dexterity modifier, and you regain all uses of it after a long rest. Uses are spent regardless of whether the attack hits or misses.

subclassFeature.name: Ready to Kill
entries: You have advantage against creatures that have not yet taken their turn, and you also have advantage on initiative rolls

subclassFeature.name: Poison Enthusiast
entries: At 9th level you gain proficiency with the poisoner's kit and can apply poisons to your weapons as a bonus action. When you apply a poison to your weapons with this trait you can choose between 4 ammo or one weapon. The poison dilutes after a minute, and in the case of weapon, it also ends if you have hit four times with it.
Additionally, your weapon attacks deal {@dice 2d4} additional poison damage.

subclassFeature.name: Unexpected Blow
entries: At 13th level, your great experience allows you to act decisively in the face of hostility. If a combat starts and you are present for its first round, you get an extra turn before it starts. During this turn, consider all other creatures present as surprised.

subclassFeature.name: Lethal Blow
entries: At level 17 you learn to deliver an accurate blow to your victim's vitals. When you hit a critical hit, you can double the damage dealt. You can use this trait once per short rest.
